Annotation.String: The InsydeNcsiPackage schema contains properties related to NcsiPackage.
This resource shall be used to represent a NcsiPackage for a Redfish implementation.
This type contains Get Link Status command response.
This type shall contain properties from Get Link Status command response.
Link status.
This indicates Link status.
Speed and duplex.
This indicates Speed and duplex.
Indicates if Auto Negotiate Flag is enabled.
Indicates if Auto Negotiate Flag is enabled. The value shall be enabled if enabled and disabled if not.
Indicates if the Auto Negotiate Flag is supported.
Indicates if the Auto Negotiate Flag is supported. The value shall be enabled if supported and disabled if not.
Indicates if Transmission of Pause frames by the NC onto the external network interface is enabled.
Indicates if Transmission of Pause frames by the NC onto the external network interface is enabled. The value shall be enabled if enabled and disabled if not.
Indicates if Reception of Pause frames by the NC from the external network interface is enabled.
Indicates if Reception of Pause frames by the NC from the external network interface is enabled. The value shall be enabled if enabled and disabled if not.
SerDes status.
This indicates SerDes status.
This indicates if auto-negotiation was completed using Parallel Detection.
This indicates if auto-negotiation was completed using Parallel Detection. The value shall be done if complete and Not Complete if not.
Indicates if OEM link settings is valid.
Indicates if OEM link settings is valid. The value shall be yes if valid and no if not.
Filtering Any VLAN or non-VLAN traffic supported.
This indicates if Filtering Any VLAN or non-VLAN traffic supported.
Link Partner is 1000BASE-T full-duplex capable.
This indicates Link Partner is 1000BASE-T full-duplex capable.
Link Partner is 1000BASE-T half-duplex capable.
This indicates Link Partner is 1000BASE-T half-duplex capable.
Link Partner is 100BASE-T4 capable.
This indicates Link Partner is 100BASE-T4 capable.
Link Partner is 100BASE-TX full-duplex capable.
This indicates Link Partner is 100BASE-TX full-duplex capable.
Link Partner is 100BASE-TX half-duplex capable.
This indicates Link Partner is 100BASE-TX half-duplex capable.
Link Partner is 10BASE-T full-duplex capable.
This indicates Link Partner is 10BASE-T full-duplex capable.
Link Partner is 10BASE-T half-duplex capable.
This indicates Link Partner is 10BASE-T half-duplex capable.
The status of Network Controller driver for the host external network interface associated with this channel.
This indicates the status of Network Controller driver for the host external network interface associated with this channel.
This type contains Get NC-SI Statistics command response.
This type shall contain properties from Get NC-SI Statistics command response.
For packets that are not dropped.
For packets that are not dropped, this field returns the number of NC-SI Control packets received and identified as NC-SI commands.
Counts the number of NC-SI Control packets that were received and dropped.
This indicates the counts the number of NC-SI Control packets that were received and dropped.
Counts the number of NC-SI command packets that were received, but are not supported.
This indicates the counts the number of NC-SI command packets that were received, but are not supported.
Counts the number of NC-SI Control Packets that were received but dropped because of an invalid checksum.
This indicates the counts the number of NC-SI Control Packets that were received but dropped because of an invalid checksum.
Counts the total number of NC-SI Control packets received.
Counts the total number of NC-SI Control packets received. This count is the sum of NC-SI Commands Received and NC-SI Control Packets Dropped.
Counts the total number of NC-SI Control packets transmitted to the Management Controller.
Counts the total number of NC-SI Control packets transmitted to the Management Controller. This count is the sum of NC-SI responses sent and AENs sent.
Counts the total number of AEN packets transmitted to the Management Controller.
This indicates the counts the total number of AEN packets transmitted to the Management Controller.
This type contains Get NC-SI Capabilities command response.
This type shall contain properties from Get NC-SI Capabilities command response.
Hardware arbitration capability supported.
This indicates if Hardware arbitration capability is supported.
Host NC Driver Indication status supported.
This indicates if Host NC Driver Indication status is supported.
Network Controller to Management Controller flow control supported.
This indicates if Network Controller to Management Controller flow control is supported.
Management Controller to Network Controller flow control supported.
This indicates if Management Controller to Network Controller flow control is supported.
Indicates if the channel accept all multicast addresses.
This indicates if the channel accept all multicast addresses is supported.
Forward this packet type to the Management Controller supported.
This indicates if Forward ARP Packets to the Management Controller is supported.
Forward this packet type to the Management Controller supported.
This indicates if Forward DHCP Client Packets to the Management Controller is supported.
Forward this packet type to the Management Controller supported.
This indicates if Forward DHCP Server Packets to the Management Controller is supported.
Forward this packet type to the Management Controller supported.
This indicates if Forward Net BIOS Packets to the Management Controller is supported.
Forward this packet type to the Management Controller supported.
This indicates if Forward IPv6 Neighbor Advertisement packets to the Management Controller is supported.
Forward this packet type to the Management Controller supported.
This indicates if Forward IPv6 Router Advertisement packets to the Management Controller is supported.
Forward this packet type to the Management Controller supported.
This indicates if Forward DHCPv6 relay and server multicast packets to the Management Controller is supported.
This defines the amount of buffering in bytes that the channel provides for inbound packets destined for the Management Controller.
The Buffering Capability field defines the amount of buffering in bytes that the channel provides for inbound packets destined for the Management Controller.
Indicates if Link Status Change AEN is enabled.
Indicates if Link Status Change AEN is enabled. The value shall be Enabled if supported and Disabled if not.
Indicates if Configuration Required AEN is enabled.
Indicates if Configuration Required AEN is enabled. The value shall be Enabled if supported and Disabled if not.
Indicates if Host NC Driver Status Change AEN is enabled.
Indicates if Host NC Driver Status Change AEN is enabled. The value shall be Enabled if supported and Disabled if not.
Indicates the number of VLAN filters.
The VLAN Filter Count field indicates the number of VLAN filters.
Indicates the number of mixed address filters that the channel supports.
The Mixed Filter Count field indicates the number of mixed address filters that the channel supports.
The number of multicast MAC address filters that the channel supports.
This indicates the number of multicast MAC address filters that the channel supports.
The number of unicast MAC address filters that the channel supports.
This indicates the number of unicast MAC address filters that the channel supports.
Indicates if VLAN is supported.
This indicates if VLAN is supported. The value shall be Supported if supported and Not Supported if not.
Indicates if Filtering VLAN and non-VLAN traffic is supported.
This indicates if Filtering VLAN and non-VLAN traffic is supported. The value shall be Supported if supported and Not Supported if not.
Indicates if Filtering any VLAN and non-VLAN traffic is supported.
This indicates if Filtering any VLAN and non-VLAN traffic is supported. The value shall be Supported if supported and Not Supported if not.
Indicates AEN OEM-specific control
This indicates AEN OEM-specific control.
This type contains Get Controller Packet Statistics command response.
This type shall contain properties from Get Controller Packet Statistics command response.
Counts the number of field has been cleard since it was last read by means of the NC-SI
Whether the corresponding field has been cleared since it was last read by means of the NC-SI.
Counts the number of bytes transmitted.
This indicates the number of bytes transmitted.
Counts the number of bytes received.
This indicates the number of bytes received.
Counts the number of goodmulticast packets received.
This indicates the number of good multicast packets received.
Counts the number of good broadcast packets received.
This indicates the number of good broadcast packets received.
Counts the number of good packets transmitted that passed L2 filtering by a specific MAC address.
This indicates the number of good packets transmitted that passed L2 filtering by a specific MAC address.
Counts the number of good multicast packets transmitted.
This indicates the number of good multicast packets transmitted.
Counts the number of good broadcast packets transmitted.
This indicates the number of good broadcast packets transmitted.
Counts the number of receive packets with FCS errors.
This indicates the number of receive packets with FCS errors.
Counts the number of receive packets with alignment errors.
This indicates the number of receive packets with alignment errors.
Counts the false carrier errors reported by the PHY.
This indicates the false carrier errors reported by the PHY.
Counts the number of received frames that passed address filtering, were less than minimum size, and had a valid FCS.
This indicates the number of received frames that passed address filtering, were less than minimum size, and had a valid FCS.
Counts the number of received frames that passed address filtering, were greater than the maximum size, and had a valid FCS.
This indicates the number of received frames that passed address filtering, were greater than the maximum size, and had a valid FCS.
Counts the number of XON packets received from the network.
This indicates the number of XON packets received from the network.
Counts the number of XOFF packets received from the network.
This indicates the number of XOFF packets received from the network.
Counts the number of XON packets transmitted to the network.
This indicates the number of XON packets transmitted to the network.
Counts the number of XOFF packets transmitted to the network.
This indicates the number of XOFF packets transmitted to the network.
Counts the number of times that a successfully transmitted packet encountered a single collision.
This indicates the number of times that a successfully transmitted packet encountered a single collision.
Counts the number of times that a transmitted packet encountered more than one collision but fewer than 16.
This indicates the number of times that a transmitted packet encountered more than one collision but fewer than 16.
Counts the number of collisions that occurred after one slot time.
This indicates the number of collisions that occurred after one slot time.
Counts the number of times that 16 or more collisions occurred on a single transmit packet.
This indicates the number of times that 16 or more collisions occurred on a single transmit packet.
Counts the number of MAC control frames received that are not XON or XOFF flow control frames.
This indicates the number of MAC control frames received that are not XON or XOFF flow control frames.
Counts the number of good packets received that are exactly 64 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets received that are exactly 64 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets received that are between 65 and 127 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets received that are between 65 and 127 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets received that are between 128 and 255 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets received that are between 128 and 255 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets received that are between 256 and 511 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets received that are between 256 and 511 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets received that are between 512 and 1023 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets received that are between 512 and 1023 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets received that are between 1024 and 1522 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets received that are between 1024 and 1522 bytes in length.
Counts the number of received frames that passed address filtering and were greater than 1523 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of received frames that passed address filtering and were greater than 1523 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets transmitted that are exactly 64 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets transmitted that are exactly 64 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets transmitted that are between 65 and 127 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets transmitted that are between 65 amd 127 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets transmitted that are between 128 and 255 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets transmitted that are between 128 and 255 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets transmitted that are between 256 and 511 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets transmitted that are between 256 and 511 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets transmitted that are between 512 and 1023 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets transmitted that are between 512 and 1023 bytes in length.
Counts the number of good packets transmitted that are between 1024 and 1522 bytes in length.
This indicates the number of good packets transmitted that are between 1024 and 1522 bytes in length.
Counts the number of transmitted frames that passed address filtering and were greater than 1523 in length.
This indicates the number of transmitted frames that passed address filtering and were greater than 1523 in length.
Counts the bytes received in all packets that did not manifest any type of error.
This indicates the bytes received in all packets that did not manifest any type of error.
Counts the number of invalid frames that were less than the minimum size.
This indicates the number of invalid frames that were less than the minimum size.
This indicates the packets that exceed the programmed MTU size and have a bad FCS value.
Counts Jabber packets, which are defined as packets that exceed the programmed MTU size and have a bad FCS value.
This type contains Get NC-SI Statistics command response.
This type shall contain properties from Get NC-SI Statistics command response.
The counts the number of Pass-through packets forwarded by the channel to the LAN.
This indicates the counts the number of Pass-through packets forwarded by the channel to the LAN.
Counts the number of Pass-through packets from the Management Controller that were dropped by the Network Controller.
This indicates the Counts the number of Pass-through packets from the Management Controller that were dropped by the Network Controller.
Counts the number of egress management packets(Management Controller to Network Controller) that were dropped.
This indicates the Counts the number of egress management packets (Management Controller to Network Controller) that were dropped.
Counts the number of Pass-through packets from the Management Controller that were undersized.
This indicates the counts the number of Pass-through packets from the Management Controller that were undersized.
Counts the number of Pass-through packets from the Management Controller that were oversized.
This indicates the counts the number of Pass-through packets from the Management Controller that were oversized
Counts the number of Pass-through packets that were received on the LAN interface of the channel.
This indicates the counts the number of Pass-through packets that were received on the LAN interface of the channel.
Counts the number of Pass-through packets that were received on the LAN interface of the channel.
This indicates the counts the number of Pass-through packets that were received on the LAN interface of the channel.
Counts the number of ingress management packets that were dropped.
This indicates the counts the number of ingress management packets that were dropped.
Counts the number of Pass-through packets from the LAN that were undersized.
This indicates the counts the number of Pass-through packets from the LAN that were undersized.
Counts the number of Pass-through packets from the LAN that were oversized.
This indicates the counts the number of Pass-through packets from the LAN that were oversized
